system.tooltip: A [[reference condition]] that causes a creature to take 1d6 + [[reference level]] damage whenever they use a [[reference maneuver]] or [[reference triggeredAction]], or make a [[reference powerRoll]] using [[reference might]] or [[reference agility]].

text.content:
While a creature is bleeding, whenever they use a main action, use a triggered action, or make a test or ability roll using Might or Agility, they lose Stamina equal to [[/damage 1d6+@level]] after the main action, triggered action, or power roll is resolved. This Stamina loss can’t be prevented in any way, and only happens once per action.

You take damage from this condition when you use a main action off your turn. For example, a signature ability used as a free triggered action with the assistance of the tactician’s Strike Now ability triggers the damage from the bleeding condition.

system.tooltip: A [[reference condition]] that limits a creature to doing only one thing on their [[reference turn]]: use a [[reference maneuver]], use a [[reference mainAction]], or use a [[reference moveAction]]. A dazed creature also can’t use [[reference triggeredAction]]{triggered actions}, [[reference freeTriggeredAction]]{free triggered actions}, or [[reference freeManeuver]]{free maneuvers}.

text.content: A creature who is dazed can do only one thing on their turn: use a main action, use a maneuver, or use a move action. A dazed creature also can’t use triggered actions, free triggered actions, or free maneuvers.

system.tooltip: A [[reference condition]] that causes a creature to take a [[reference bane]] on [[reference characteristic]]{characteristics} against the source of their fear. The creature can’t willingly move closer to the source of their fear, and that source gains an [[reference edge]] on ability rolls made against the creature.

text.content: When a creature is frightened, any ability roll they make against the source of their fear takes a bane. If that source is a creature, their ability rolls made against the frightened creature gain an edge. A frightened creature can’t willingly move closer to the source of their fear if they know the location of that source. If a creature gains the frightened condition from one source while already frightened by a different source, the new condition replaces the old one.

system.tooltip: A [[reference condition]] that reduces a creature’s speed to 0 and causes them to take a [[reference bane]] on abilities that don’t target the creature, object, or effect that has them grabbed.

text.content:
A creature who is grabbed has speed 0, can’t be force moved except by a creature, object, or effect that has them grabbed, can’t use the @UUID[Compendium.draw-steel.abilities.Item.emug9cXuwndDrWzu]{Knockback} maneuver, and takes a bane on abilities that don’t target the creature, object, or effect that has them grabbed. If a creature is grabbed by another creature and that creature moves, they bring the grabbed creature with them. If a creature’s size is equal to or less than the size of a creature they have grabbed, their speed is halved while they have that creature grabbed.

A creature who has another creature grabbed can use a maneuver to move the grabbed creature into an unoccupied space adjacent to them.

A creature can release a creature they have grabbed at any time to end that condition (no action required). A grabbed creature can attempt to escape being grabbed using the @UUID[Compendium.draw-steel.abilities.Item.iD1SlB15GXJFALya]{Escape Grab} maneuver. If a grabbed creature teleports, or if either the grabbed creature or the creature grabbing them is force moved so that both creatures are not adjacent to each other, that creature is no longer grabbed.

A creature can grab only creatures of their size or smaller. If a creature’s Might score is 2 or higher, they can grab any creature larger than them with a size equal to or less than their Might score.

Unless otherwise indicated, a creature can grab only one creature at a time.

system.tooltip: A [[reference condition]] that causes a creature to become flat on the [[reference ground]]. [[reference strike]]{Strikes} made by a prone creature take a [[reference bane]], and [[reference melee]] [[reference ability]]{abilities} used against a prone creature gain an [[reference edge]]

text.content:
While a creature is prone, they are flat on the ground, any strike they make takes a bane, and melee abilities used against them gain an edge. A prone creature must crawl to move along the ground, which costs 1 additional square of movement for every square crawled. A creature can’t climb, jump, swim, or fly while prone. If they are climbing, flying, or jumping when knocked prone, they fall.

Unless the ability or effect that imposed the prone condition says otherwise, a prone creature can stand up using the Stand Up maneuver. A creature adjacent to a willing prone creature can likewise use the Stand Up maneuver to make that creature stand up.

A creature who is restrained has speed 0, can’t use the @UUID[Compendium.draw-steel.abilities.Item.XeUU0Blvi0fy0b2G]{Stand Up} maneuver, and can’t be force moved. A restrained creature takes a bane on ability rolls and on Might and Agility tests, and abilities used against them gain an edge.

If a creature teleports while restrained, that condition ends.

system.tooltip: A [[reference condition]] that reduces a creature’s speed to 2.

text.content: A creature who is slowed has speed 2 unless their speed is already lower, and they can’t shift.
A creature who is surprised can’t take triggered or free triggered actions and ability power rolls against them gain an edge.

A creature who is taunted has a double bane on ability rolls for any ability that doesn’t target the creature who taunted them, as long as they have line of effect to that creature. If a creature gains the taunted condition from one source while already taunted by a different source, the new condition replaces the old one.

system.tooltip: A [[reference condition]] that causes a creature to take a [[reference bane]] on power rolls.

text.content: A creature who is weakened takes a bane on power rolls.

system.tooltip: A state a [[reference hero]] enters when their [[reference stamina]] is 0 or lower but doesn’t reach the negative of their [[reference winded]] value. While dying, a hero is [[reference bleeding]] and they can’t use the @UUID[Compendium.draw-steel.abilities.Item.nYPJN8Ce2dX9H09K]{Catch Breath} maneuver in combat. A hero dies when their Stamina equals the negative of their winded value.

text.content:
When your Stamina is 0 or lower, you are dying. While dying, you can’t use the Catch Breath maneuver in combat. Additionally, you are bleeding, and this instance of the condition can’t be negated or removed in any way until you are no longer dying. While you are dying, you can still act, your allies can help you spend Recoveries in combat, and you can spend Recoveries out of combat as usual.

While your Stamina is lower than 0, if it reaches the negative of your winded value, you die. When you die, you can’t be brought back to life without the use of a special powerful item, such as a Scroll of Resurrection.
